People: Emperor Ferdinand II, Frederick V, Gustavus Adolphus
Nations: Austria, Netherlands, France, Spain, Sweden, Bohemia
Desc: Conflict over religious and political power
Causes: Catholic Ferdinand II sought to crush Protestant states in Europe
Consequences: A shifting of political and religious power across Europe; Sweden and France gain more influence; Austrian Habsburgs gain more control in central Europe
Opposing Sides: Catholics and associated states against Protestants and associated states
Outcomes: Treaty of Westphalia recognizes the sovereignty of various German states
Significance: Centralized political and religious power is limited and religious freedom is established in many parts of Germany and Central Europe
